intro: Malacantha azaguieana, commonly known as the Azaguié cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of West Africa. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its structure includes thick, fleshy stems that store water and reduce transpiration. Malacantha azaguieana is often found in rocky soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
